interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Towering Inferno [DVD]
Review Date: 2018/06/01
Store: Paul Newman  (Actor),     Steve McQueen  (Actor),     Irwin Allen  (Director),     John Guillermin  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, Action, General
Product Description: ['Product description', 'The Towering Inferno', 'Amazon.com', "Disaster movies used to work because there was little certainty as to who would survive. Not so in this film, really an amalgam of two original stories, about a group of well-to-do celebrants at the top floor of a skyscraper. Cheapo electrical wiring and bad construction management cause an enormous blaze at the lower floors, steadily rising to consume the revelers. Newman's an architect, McQueen a firefighter, and Fred Astaire a kind old gentleman, for which he was Oscar-nominated. O.J. Simpson plays a security guard who rescues a cat. Now that's a disaster.", '--Keith Simanton']
Average Rating: 4.7

Review Text: Highly recommend for disaster film fans. To have been made in the 70’s, the special effects are pretty good. Good story line.

reference_summary:
A Charlie Brown Christmas 50th Anniversay Deluxe Edition (DVD)
Various  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Holidays & Seasonal, Christmas
["Christmastime is here. Happiness and cheer. And for Peanuts fans everywhere, it just wouldn't be Christmas without this classic holiday delight. Christmas lights may be twinkling red and green, but Charlie Brown has the Yuletide blues. To get in the holiday spirit, he takes Lucy's advice and directs the Christmas play. And what's a Christmas play without a Christmas tree? But everyone makes fun of the short, spindly nevergreen Charlie Brown brings back - until the real meaning of Christmas works its magic once again.", 'CHARLIE BROWN: Spruce up your Christmas cheer this year as Charlie takes on the spirit of Christmas in hopes to find the real magic of the season once again.', 'CHARLIE BROWN: Spruce up your Christmas cheer this year as Charlie takes on the spirit of Christmas in hopes to find the real magic of the season once again.', 'KEEPSAKE: It is the first TV special based on the comic strip Peanuts, by Charles M. Shultz. It has been honored with an Emmy and a Peabody Award and has become an annual tradition in the United States.', 'KEEPSAKE: It is the first TV special based on the comic strip Peanuts, by Charles M. Shultz. It has been honored with an Emmy and a Peabody Award and has become an annual tradition in the United States.', 'DELUXE ADDITION: This deluxe edition features It’s Christmastime Again, Charlie Brown. It also includes A Christmas Miracle: The Making of a Charlie Brown Christmas.', 'DELUXE ADDITION: This deluxe edition features It’s Christmastime Again, Charlie Brown. It also includes A Christmas Miracle: The Making of a Charlie Brown Christmas.', 'OFFICIALLY LICENSED: This Classic Charlie Brown story is officially licensed by Peanuts and is 100% authentic.', 'OFFICIALLY LICENSED: This Classic Charlie Brown story is officially licensed by Peanuts and is 100% authentic.', 'GIFTABLE: Gift this Anniversary Deluxe DVD for new generations and even older ones as the perfect stocking stuffer.', 'GIFTABLE: Gift this Anniversary Deluxe DVD for new generations and even older ones as the perfect stocking stuffer.']

A precious Christmas tradition.
Ultimate Disaster Pack (Earthquake / Airport / The Hindenburg / Rollercoaster) [DVD]
Burt Lancaster  (Actor),     Charlton Heston  (Actor),     James Goldstone  (Director),     Mark Robson  (Director, Producer)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Action & Adventure
["Danger, destruction and mayhem…the Ultimate Disaster Pack features four blockbuster films filled with natural and manmade catastrophes that will blow you away. The pulse pounding action begins with Earthquake, an Academy Award-winning film about heroes rising after a catastrophic earthquake levels Los Angeles. The suspense continues with the original Airport, nominated for 10 Academy Awards including Best Picture, which launched the popular 1970s disaster film genre and became a box office smash. One of aviation's most infamous events in history is brought back to life in The Hindenburg, a gripping suspense thriller that reveals the intricate plots behind the historic airship disaster of 1937. Unexpected twists and turns await in Rollercoaster when a determined terrorist targets America's most popular attraction, and its riders, for senseless destruction. Featuring all-star casts that include Charlton Heston, Burt Lancaster, Dean Martin, George C. Scott, George Segal and many more, the Ultimate Disaster Pack will pull you in and never let you go!"]

A Night to Remember (The Criterion Collection) [DVD]
Kenneth More  (Actor),     Honor Blackman  (Actor),     Roy Ward Baker  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Criterion Collection, All
['On April 14, 1912, just before midnight, the unsinkable Titanic struck an iceberg. In less than three hours, it had plunged to the bottom of the sea, taking with it more than 1,500 of its 2,200 passengers. In his unforgettable rendering of Walter Lord’s book of the same name,', 'A Night to Remember', ', the acclaimed British director Roy Ward Baker (', 'Don’t Bother to Knock', ') depicts with sensitivity, awe, and a fine sense of tragedy the ship’s final hours. Featuring remarkably restrained performances,', 'A Night to Remember', 'is cinema’s subtlest, finest dramatization of this monumental twentieth-century catastrophe.']
{'Genre': 'Drama, Documentary/Biography', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Black & White, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Roy Ward Baker, Kenneth More, David McCallum, Tucker McGuire, Honor Blackman, Michael Goodliffe', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 3 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.4 x 7.5 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'CRRN2134DVD', 'Director': 'Roy Ward Baker', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Black & White, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 3 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 27, 2012', 'Actors': 'Kenneth More, Honor Blackman, Michael Goodliffe, David McCallum, Tucker McGuire', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Criterion Collection', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '2'}
This version is the most historically accurate version out. Except for the actual sinking. We all know that the ship broke in half. But in 1958 they didn’t know that. I strongly recommend the 2 dvd special edition. It has an interview with Eva Hart, a Titanic survivor.  Very interesting.
I strongly recommend the 2 dvd special edition

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Interests**: The user maintains a strong affinity for classic holiday films, particularly animated and family-oriented content, while also expressing a keen interest in disaster films. Their taste signifies a preference for high-stakes narratives that intertwine thrilling storytelling with emotional depth.
  
- **Traditions**: They value nostalgic experiences evoking childhood memories, seeking films that encapsulate holiday spirit alongside intense narratives, with an emphasis on historical accuracy in storytelling.

- **Movie Preferences**: Recently, the user has engaged with classic disaster films, reinforcing their interest in historical themes. Their preferences reflect a growing inclination towards documentaries and biographical dramas that delve into real-life events, showcasing an appreciation for cinematic craftsmanship.

- **Gifting Attitude**: They regard collectible media as thoughtful gifts, particularly during holidays, and favor comprehensive collector's sets that explore specific genres, highlighting their desire for quality and depth in collections.

- **Quality Judgment**: The user displays a tendency to rate content highly, grounded in personal enjoyment and cultural appreciation, and is inclined to recommend quality releases that enhance understanding of significant historical events. Their latest engagement underscores a deep admiration for classic disaster narratives, reinforcing their nostalgic connection and enjoyment of well-crafted cinematic experiences.
